name: The Sad Story of Emmeline Burns
description: A free game created by Ebi-Hime, author of Asphyxia, The Way We ALL GO, and Strawberry Vinegar. TSSofEB is a free yuri (girls' love) game created for a game jam. As the saying goes, dead men tell no tales. They only leave tales behind.
minimum_requirements: OS: Win XP+ Processor: 1Ghz Memory: 512 MB RAM Graphics: DirectX® 9 Compatible Graphics Card Storage: 600 MB available space Sound Card: DirectSound-compatible sound card

reviews.review_text: I've played this game for 10 minutes and there's already so much plot that I ran out of tissues from how emotional this is. Must play game.
The atmosphere looks very interesting, also good for free 100% achievements  However there was an error with the skip function, it caused the game to freeze and gave an error screen

A short and sweet kinetic novel about the forbidden love between two girls in the 19th century.   The writing was alright, and it's good to see variety in these. And although it is between two women, it doesn't ruin it by over-sexualizing the characters which would have been expected. Thankfully it's not the case.  It's free too. Try it.

Masterpiece ღ  ! Don't read if you don't like spoilers !  It has been a really long time since I've read such a great visual novel. I'm usually not into free games since there isn't much work on them and they have really poor stories , drawing style etc but this one got my attention by just randomly seeing it. First i had doubts i mean the drawing looked so good , really girlish design but then i was wondering about the content in this game if it was satisfying enough. Well why not giving it a try? After i downloaded it and started it i already fell in love with the beautiful main menu ! Those soft girlish pastel colours , style of drawing...top top top!   When the game started i was feeling like im reading a story about myself..a life story to be honest. The main Heroine in this game ( Toma ) is really in a lot of ways like me even tho its just a game..i couldn't believe how this is similar to me like i was talking to the creator of this game and he made a game out of me with a few changes . Since i had the similar thing as Toma with the name chosen by her mother which wasn't supposed to be Toma but Amelia, i remembered how my mother told me something long long time ago.   It feels really creepy if you play a game and its like you can look into a mirror ..see yourself . The more i was reading, i could replace myself with Toma .. being different then others seems really annoying and you want to change yourself etc i guess its just us people in this world who can't be happy with what we are or what we have. I guess another reason why i got attached to this game is that im interested in History,Victorian history..just old things that not everyone cares to talk about or do researches and this game has this ' old ' style. I love how this game is made so realistic and it has a rich story which i didn't read for a long time as mentioned.  Well the game is not really long and you can finish it between 1-2 hours but i personally didn't feel like to just read fast and see what happens. The story made me feel like im experiencing it in real life and i wanted to understand or better to say ' feel ' the story. Since im a sensitive person, to be honest i cried a few times while reading .. wonderful music , art , in game atmosphere. Maybe im hyping it to much but i think this game deserves to become a Movie. I would even pay money for the game because in my opinion it shouldn't be a free game its way better than just a free game actually .  After finishing it i got the strength to love myself the way i am even more and appreciate it . I learned that being the unique ' yourself' is better than wanting being someone different and that every single person has their own story . We live for reasons and out of each single person there will be some day a different story..beautiful story, happy story , sad story etc . This is a 'game' with quality after all it teaches the person who is playing it something really valuable which you don't see in other games . Another thing which you can learn is that a game doesn't need to be famous or hyped to have quality.  At all i highly really highly recommend it ! For me its one of my favorite games till now . I think you really should try it out ! Don't read the story fast and try to focus on the speech of the characters im sure you will experience the game different then just fast clicking it away.   Merci for reading  Stay true to yourself ღ

'I want this moment to last forever.'   A short, bittersweet tear-jerker more than worthy of a readthrough. Ebi-hime is a wonderfully gifted writer, her sentimental storytelling a perfect match for the soft pastels of SillySelly's girlish art; to offer  The Sad Story of Emmeline Burns  for free significantly undersells the quality immensely -- absolutely beautiful kinetic novel, case closed.
It's a wonderful game. I easily fell in love with the style of it.
Classy 19nth century girls comment on love and poetry, sad, inspiring, absurd, refined. A love story of the ages told through the perspective aristocratic melancholy.  10/10 Would read again
404 : Sad Founded

Very well done story. There aren't exactly any choices to be made, but the story is beautiful and meaningful. The characters express a sort of Carpe Diem message which I feel is relevant to the VN audience. Too many of us suffer from some sort of depression, anxiety, or other social disorders. I myself suffer from social anxiety and it's one of the many factors that influenced my initial delving into the VN world. The characters are relatable, the references are witty and well thought out. It was a wonderful experience. Hope the creators keep up their work. It's nice to see a Visual Novel that's more than smut and that additionally explores the realms this one does. Love and Caring is beautiful, regardless of gender. Anyways, now that I've rambled enough in my review. I conclude.
Plot 8.5/10 Character Designs 10/10

Also, really awkward yuri between kids, ghosts, and an out of body experience from being possesed by your lesbian ancestor. Fun times? Not really.

Unfortunately, I forgot to minimize the game when I went out to get something to eat - around the part where they kiss. Needless to say, somebody else saw it.  10/10 would get my preference questioned again

I am Toma Andrews.  I am a young British girl skipping school to visit a graveyard. On my way there, I run into a Victorian girl who precedes to tell me about the love story of two young girls before it all burns down.  Then after some time, I end up paying back a friend by being her girlfriend.  At least I have some wonderful art and writing, if a little bit too sweet. Like sugar on a Werther's Original.  It's free, I'd recommend it.

It's a cute story and is honestly better than some things you could pay for. The fact that there's no gameplay at all made it a wee bit boring (to me, at least), but it's real sweet and it's free and I don't know what else I need to say to advertise it tbh.
